top_categories.workout_context: Pirinexus 360’s 211-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
Racing Pirinexus 360 isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Pirinexus 360’s mixed gravel and asphalt with volcanic zones and technical border descent demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.

Pirinexus 360’s mixed gravel and asphalt with volcanic zones and technical border descent and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Pirinexus 360 when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Pirinexus 360 rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Every session at Pirinexus 360 intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
At 211 miles, Pirinexus 360 rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Pirinexus 360’s mixed gravel and asphalt with volcanic zones and technical border descent delivers on race day.
Pirinexus 360’s 11,150ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Pirinexus 360 — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Pirinexus 360. Make this intensity feel like home.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 211 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 211 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Pirinexus 360. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Pirinexus 360 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on mixed gravel and asphalt with volcanic zones and technical border descent to build confidence.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Race Simulation, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 211 miles of mixed gravel and asphalt with volcanic zones and technical border descent in Girona, Catalonia, Spain.
